intro: Echinospermum redowskii var. karelinii, commonly known as the Karakul echinospermum, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny, globe-shaped seed heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
